          • --cache-doc-scaladoc-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-doc-scaladoc-write-to=<str> (--cache-doc-scaladoc-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-doc-scaladoc-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-doc-scaladoc-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
      • scala-platform.doc.scaladoc
        A scala platform.
        • Advanced options
          • --scala-platform-doc-scaladoc-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --scala-platform-doc-scaladoc-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--scala-platform-doc-scaladoc-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --scala-platform-doc-scaladoc-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --scala-platform-doc-scaladoc-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]scala-platform-doc-scaladoc-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --[no-]scala-platform-doc-scaladoc-fatal-warnings (default: False)
            The default for the "fatal_warnings" argument for targets of this language.
          • --scala-platform-doc-scaladoc-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --scala-platform-doc-scaladoc-repl-spec=<str> (default: '//:scala-repl')
            Address to be used for custom scala runtime.
          • --scala-platform-doc-scaladoc-runtime-spec=<str> (default: '//:scala-library')
            Address to be used for custom scala runtime.
          • --scala-platform-doc-scaladoc-scala_2_10_repl=<target_option> (default: //:scala_2_10_repl)
            Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the scala_2_10_repl jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'org.scala-lang', base_name=u'scala-compiler', rev=u'2.10.4', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=()), JarDependency(org=u'org.scala-lang', base_name=u'jline', rev=u'2.10.4', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
          • --scala-platform-doc-scaladoc-scala_2_11_repl=<target_option> (default: //:scala_2_11_repl)
            Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the scala_2_11_repl jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'org.scala-lang', base_name=u'scala-compiler', rev=u'2.11.7', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
          • --scala-platform-doc-scaladoc-scala_repl=<target_option> (default: //:scala_repl)
            Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the scala_repl jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'org.scala-lang', base_name=u'scala-compiler', rev=None, force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=()), JarDependency(org=u'org.scala-lang', base_name=u'jline', rev=u'2.10.4', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
          • --scala-platform-doc-scaladoc-scalac=<target_option> (default: //:scalac)
            Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the scalac jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'org.scala-lang', base_name=u'scala-compiler', rev=None, force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
          • --scala-platform-doc-scaladoc-scalac_2_10=<target_option> (default: //:scalac_2_10)
            Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the scalac_2_10 jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'org.scala-lang', base_name=u'scala-compiler', rev=u'2.10.4', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
          • --scala-platform-doc-scaladoc-scalac_2_11=<target_option> (default: //:scalac_2_11)
            Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the scalac_2_11 jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'org.scala-lang', base_name=u'scala-compiler', rev=u'2.11.7', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
          • --scala-platform-doc-scaladoc-scalastyle=<target_option> (default: //:scalastyle)
            Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the scalastyle jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'org.scalastyle', base_name=u'scalastyle_custom', rev=None, force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
          • --scala-platform-doc-scaladoc-scalastyle_2_10=<target_option> (default: //:scalastyle_2_10)
            Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the scalastyle_2_10 jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'org.scalastyle', base_name=u'scalastyle_2.10', rev=u'0.3.2', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
          • --scala-platform-doc-scaladoc-scalastyle_2_11=<target_option> (default: //:scalastyle_2_11)
            Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the scalastyle_2_11 jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'org.scalastyle', base_name=u'scalastyle_2.11', rev=u'0.8.0', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
          • --[no-]scala-platform-doc-scaladoc-strict-deps (default: False)
            The default for the "strict_deps" argument for targets of this language.
          • --scala-platform-doc-scaladoc-suffix-version=<str> (default: None)
            Scala suffix to be used when a custom version is specified. For example 2.10
          • --scala-platform-doc-scaladoc-version=<str> (default: '2.10')
            The scala "platform version", which is suffixed onto all published libraries. This should match the declared compiler/library versions. Version specified will allow the user provide some sane defaults for common versions of scala. If version is something other than one of the common versions the user will be able to override the defaults by specifying "custom" as the --version, custom build targets can be specified in the targets for //:scalac and //:scala-library
    • eclipse
      Create an Eclipse project from the given targets.
      • cache.eclipse
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-eclipse-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-eclipse-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-eclipse-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-eclipse-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-eclipse-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-eclipse-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-eclipse-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-eclipse-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-eclipse-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-eclipse-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-eclipse-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-eclipse-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-eclipse-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-eclipse-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-eclipse-read-from=<str> (--cache-eclipse-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-eclipse-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-eclipse-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-eclipse-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-eclipse-write-to=<str> (--cache-eclipse-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-eclipse-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-eclipse-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
    • ensime
      Create an Ensime project from the given targets.
      • cache.ensime
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-ensime-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-ensime-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-ensime-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-ensime-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-ensime-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-ensime-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-ensime-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-ensime-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-ensime-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-ensime-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-ensime-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-ensime-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-ensime-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-ensime-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-ensime-read-from=<str> (--cache-ensime-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-ensime-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-ensime-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-ensime-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-ensime-write-to=<str> (--cache-ensime-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-ensime-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-ensime-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
    • export
      Export project information in JSON format.
      • cache.export
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-export-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-export-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-export-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-export-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-export-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-export-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-export-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-export-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-export-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-export-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-export-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-export-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-export-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-export-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-export-read-from=<str> (--cache-export-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-export-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-export-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-export-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-export-write-to=<str> (--cache-export-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-export-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-export-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
      • thrift-binary.export
        • Advanced options
          • --thrift-binary-export-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --thrift-binary-export-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--thrift-binary-export-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --thrift-binary-export-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --thrift-binary-export-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]thrift-binary-export-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --thrift-binary-export-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --thrift-binary-export-supportdir=<str> (default: 'bin/thrift')
            Find thrift binaries under this dir. Used as part of the path to lookup thetool with --binary-util-baseurls and --pants-bootstrapdir
          • --thrift-binary-export-version=<str> (default: '0.9.2')
            Thrift compiler version. Used as part of the path to lookup thetool with --binary-util-baseurls and --pants-bootstrapdir
    • export-classpath
      Create stable symlinks for runtime classpath entries for JVM targets.
      • cache.export-classpath
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-export-classpath-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-export-classpath-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-export-classpath-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-export-classpath-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-export-classpath-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-export-classpath-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-export-classpath-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-export-classpath-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-export-classpath-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-export-classpath-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-export-classpath-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-export-classpath-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-export-classpath-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-export-classpath-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-export-classpath-read-from=<str> (--cache-export-classpath-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-export-classpath-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-export-classpath-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-export-classpath-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-export-classpath-write-to=<str> (--cache-export-classpath-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-export-classpath-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-export-classpath-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
    • filedeps
      List all source and BUILD files a target transitively depends on.
      • cache.filedeps
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-filedeps-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-filedeps-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-filedeps-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-filedeps-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-filedeps-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-filedeps-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-filedeps-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-filedeps-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-filedeps-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-filedeps-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-filedeps-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-filedeps-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-filedeps-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-filedeps-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-filedeps-read-from=<str> (--cache-filedeps-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-filedeps-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-filedeps-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-filedeps-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-filedeps-write-to=<str> (--cache-filedeps-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-filedeps-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-filedeps-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
    • filemap
      Print a mapping from source file to the target that owns the source file.
      • cache.filemap
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-filemap-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-filemap-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-filemap-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-filemap-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-filemap-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-filemap-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-filemap-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-filemap-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-filemap-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-filemap-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-filemap-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-filemap-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-filemap-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-filemap-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-filemap-read-from=<str> (--cache-filemap-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-filemap-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-filemap-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-filemap-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-filemap-write-to=<str> (--cache-filemap-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-filemap-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-filemap-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
    • filter
      Filter the input targets based on various criteria.
      • cache.filter
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-filter-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-filter-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-filter-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-filter-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-filter-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-filter-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-filter-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-filter-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-filter-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-filter-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-filter-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-filter-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-filter-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-filter-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-filter-read-from=<str> (--cache-filter-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-filter-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-filter-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-filter-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-filter-write-to=<str> (--cache-filter-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-filter-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-filter-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
    • gen
      Generate code.
      • gen.aapt
        Process resources for Android targets with the Android Asset Packaging Tool (aapt).
        • Basic options
          • --gen-aapt-build-tools-version=<str> (default: None)
            Use this Android build-tools version to compile resources.
          • --gen-aapt-ignored-assets=<PATTERN> (default: '!.svn:!.git:!.ds_store:!*.scc:.*:<dir>_*:!CVS:!thumbs.db:!picasa.ini:!*~:BUILD*')
            Patterns the aapt tools should ignore as they search the resource_dir.
          • --gen-aapt-sdk-path=<str> (default: None)
            Use the Android SDK at this path.
          • --gen-aapt-target-sdk=<str> (default: None)
            Use this Android SDK to compile resources. Overrides AndroidManifest.xml.
        • Advanced options
          • --gen-aapt-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --gen-aapt-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--gen-aapt-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --gen-aapt-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --gen-aapt-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]gen-aapt-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --gen-aapt-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
      • cache.gen.aapt
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-gen-aapt-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-aapt-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-gen-aapt-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-gen-aapt-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-gen-aapt-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-gen-aapt-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-gen-aapt-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-gen-aapt-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-aapt-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-gen-aapt-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-gen-aapt-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-aapt-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-gen-aapt-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-gen-aapt-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-gen-aapt-read-from=<str> (--cache-gen-aapt-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-gen-aapt-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-gen-aapt-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-gen-aapt-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-gen-aapt-write-to=<str> (--cache-gen-aapt-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-gen-aapt-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-gen-aapt-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
      • gen.antlr
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]gen-antlr-use-nailgun (default: True)
            Use nailgun to make repeated invocations of this task quicker.
        • Advanced options
          • --[no-]gen-antlr-allow-dups (default: False)
            Allow multiple targets specifying the same sources. If duplicates are allowed, the logic of find_sources will associate generated sources with the least-dependent targets that generate them.
          • --[no-]gen-antlr-allow-empty (default: True)
            Skip targets with no sources defined.
          • --gen-antlr-antlr3=<target_option> (default: //:antlr-3.4)
            Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the antlr3 jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'org.antlr', base_name=u'antlr', rev=u'3.4', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
          • --gen-antlr-antlr4=<target_option> (default: //:antlr-4)
            Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the antlr4 jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'org.antlr', base_name=u'antlr4', rev=u'4.1', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=()), JarDependency(org=u'org.antlr', base_name=u'antlr4-runtime', rev=u'4.1', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
          • --gen-antlr-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --gen-antlr-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--gen-antlr-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --gen-antlr-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --gen-antlr-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]gen-antlr-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --gen-antlr-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --gen-antlr-nailgun-connect-attempts=<int> (default: 5)
            Max attempts for nailgun connects.
          • --gen-antlr-nailgun-server=<target_option> (default: //:nailgun-server)
            Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the nailgun-server jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'com.martiansoftware', base_name=u'nailgun-server', rev=u'0.9.1', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
          • --gen-antlr-nailgun-timeout-seconds=<float> (default: 10.0)
            Timeout (secs) for nailgun startup.
      • cache.gen.antlr
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-gen-antlr-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-antlr-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options

          • --cache-gen-antlr-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-gen-antlr-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-gen-antlr-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-gen-antlr-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-antlr-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-gen-antlr-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-gen-antlr-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-antlr-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-gen-antlr-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-gen-antlr-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-gen-antlr-read-from=<str> (--cache-gen-antlr-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-gen-antlr-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-gen-antlr-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-gen-antlr-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-gen-antlr-write-to=<str> (--cache-gen-antlr-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-gen-antlr-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-gen-antlr-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
      • gen.go-thrift
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]gen-go-thrift-strict (default: True)
            Run thrift compiler with strict warnings.
        • Advanced options
          • --[no-]gen-go-thrift-allow-dups (default: False)
            Allow multiple targets specifying the same sources. If duplicates are allowed, the logic of find_sources will associate generated sources with the least-dependent targets that generate them.
          • --[no-]gen-go-thrift-allow-empty (default: True)
            Skip targets with no sources defined.
          • --gen-go-thrift-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --gen-go-thrift-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--gen-go-thrift-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --gen-go-thrift-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --gen-go-thrift-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]gen-go-thrift-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --gen-go-thrift-gen-options=<str> (default: None)
            Use these apache thrift go gen options.
          • --gen-go-thrift-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --gen-go-thrift-thrift-import=<str> (default: 'github.com/apache/thrift/lib/go/thrift')
            Use this thrift-import gen option to thrift.
          • --gen-go-thrift-thrift-import-target=<str> (default: 'contrib/go/3rdparty/go/github.com/apache/thrift/lib/go/thrift:thrift')
            Use this thrift import on symbolic defs.
      • thrift-binary.gen.go-thrift
        • Advanced options
          • --thrift-binary-gen-go-thrift-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --thrift-binary-gen-go-thrift-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--thrift-binary-gen-go-thrift-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --thrift-binary-gen-go-thrift-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --thrift-binary-gen-go-thrift-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]thrift-binary-gen-go-thrift-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --thrift-binary-gen-go-thrift-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --thrift-binary-gen-go-thrift-supportdir=<str> (default: 'bin/thrift')
            Find thrift binaries under this dir. Used as part of the path to lookup thetool with --binary-util-baseurls and --pants-bootstrapdir
          • --thrift-binary-gen-go-thrift-version=<str> (default: '0.9.2')
            Thrift compiler version. Used as part of the path to lookup thetool with --binary-util-baseurls and --pants-bootstrapdir
      • cache.gen.go-thrift
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-gen-go-thrift-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-go-thrift-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-gen-go-thrift-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-gen-go-thrift-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-gen-go-thrift-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-gen-go-thrift-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-gen-go-thrift-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-gen-go-thrift-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-go-thrift-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-gen-go-thrift-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-gen-go-thrift-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-go-thrift-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-gen-go-thrift-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-gen-go-thrift-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-gen-go-thrift-read-from=<str> (--cache-gen-go-thrift-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-gen-go-thrift-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-gen-go-thrift-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-gen-go-thrift-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-gen-go-thrift-write-to=<str> (--cache-gen-go-thrift-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-gen-go-thrift-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-gen-go-thrift-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.

      • gen.jaxb
        Generates java source files from jaxb schema (.xsd).
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]gen-jaxb-use-nailgun (default: True)
            Use nailgun to make repeated invocations of this task quicker.
        • Advanced options
          • --[no-]gen-jaxb-allow-dups (default: False)
            Allow multiple targets specifying the same sources. If duplicates are allowed, the logic of find_sources will associate generated sources with the least-dependent targets that generate them.
          • --[no-]gen-jaxb-allow-empty (default: True)
            Skip targets with no sources defined.
          • --gen-jaxb-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --gen-jaxb-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--gen-jaxb-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --gen-jaxb-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --gen-jaxb-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]gen-jaxb-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --gen-jaxb-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --gen-jaxb-nailgun-connect-attempts=<int> (default: 5)
            Max attempts for nailgun connects.
          • --gen-jaxb-nailgun-server=<target_option> (default: //:nailgun-server)
            Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the nailgun-server jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'com.martiansoftware', base_name=u'nailgun-server', rev=u'0.9.1', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
          • --gen-jaxb-nailgun-timeout-seconds=<float> (default: 10.0)
            Timeout (secs) for nailgun startup.
      • cache.gen.jaxb
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-gen-jaxb-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-jaxb-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-gen-jaxb-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.

            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.

            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
