            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-gen-jaxb-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-gen-jaxb-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-jaxb-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-gen-jaxb-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-gen-jaxb-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-gen-jaxb-read-from=<str> (--cache-gen-jaxb-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-gen-jaxb-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-gen-jaxb-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-gen-jaxb-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-gen-jaxb-write-to=<str> (--cache-gen-jaxb-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-gen-jaxb-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-gen-jaxb-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
      • gen.protoc
        • Advanced options
          • --[no-]gen-protoc-allow-dups (default: False)
            Allow multiple targets specifying the same sources. If duplicates are allowed, the logic of find_sources will associate generated sources with the least-dependent targets that generate them.
          • --[no-]gen-protoc-allow-empty (default: True)
            Skip targets with no sources defined.
          • --gen-protoc-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --gen-protoc-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--gen-protoc-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --gen-protoc-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --gen-protoc-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --gen-protoc-extra_path=<str> (--gen-protoc-extra_path=<str>) ..., --gen-protoc-extra_path="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --gen-protoc-extra_path="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: [])
            Prepend this path onto PATH in the environment before executing protoc. Intended to help protoc find its plugins.
          • --[no-]gen-protoc-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --gen-protoc-javadeps=<str> (--gen-protoc-javadeps=<str>) ..., --gen-protoc-javadeps="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --gen-protoc-javadeps="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['3rdparty:protobuf-java'])
            Dependencies to bootstrap this task for generating java code. When changing this parameter you may also need to update --version.
          • --gen-protoc-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --gen-protoc-protoc-plugins=<str> (--gen-protoc-protoc-plugins=<str>) ..., --gen-protoc-protoc-plugins="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --gen-protoc-protoc-plugins="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: [])
            Names of protobuf plugins to invoke. Protoc will look for an executable named protoc-gen-$NAME on PATH.
          • --gen-protoc-supportdir=<str> (default: 'bin/protobuf')
            Path to use for the protoc binary. Used as part of the path to lookup thetool under --pants-bootstrapdir.
          • --gen-protoc-version=<str> (default: '2.4.1')
            Version of protoc. Used to create the default --javadeps and as part of the path to lookup the tool with --pants-support-baseurls and --pants-bootstrapdir. When changing this parameter you may also need to update --javadeps.
      • cache.gen.protoc
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-gen-protoc-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-protoc-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-gen-protoc-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-gen-protoc-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-gen-protoc-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-gen-protoc-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-gen-protoc-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-gen-protoc-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-protoc-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-gen-protoc-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-gen-protoc-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-protoc-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-gen-protoc-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-gen-protoc-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-gen-protoc-read-from=<str> (--cache-gen-protoc-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-gen-protoc-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-gen-protoc-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-gen-protoc-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-gen-protoc-write-to=<str> (--cache-gen-protoc-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-gen-protoc-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-gen-protoc-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
      • gen.ragel
        • Advanced options
          • --[no-]gen-ragel-allow-dups (default: False)
            Allow multiple targets specifying the same sources. If duplicates are allowed, the logic of find_sources will associate generated sources with the least-dependent targets that generate them.
          • --[no-]gen-ragel-allow-empty (default: True)
            Skip targets with no sources defined.
          • --gen-ragel-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --gen-ragel-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--gen-ragel-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --gen-ragel-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --gen-ragel-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]gen-ragel-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --gen-ragel-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --gen-ragel-supportdir=<str> (default: 'bin/ragel')
            The path to find the ragel binary. Used as part of the path to lookup thetool with --pants-support-baseurls and --pants_bootstrapdir.
          • --gen-ragel-version=<str> (default: '6.9')
            The version of ragel to use. Used as part of the path to lookup thetool with --pants-support-baseurls and --pants-bootstrapdir
      • cache.gen.ragel
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-gen-ragel-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-ragel-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-gen-ragel-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-gen-ragel-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-gen-ragel-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-gen-ragel-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-gen-ragel-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-gen-ragel-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-ragel-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-gen-ragel-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-gen-ragel-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-ragel-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-gen-ragel-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-gen-ragel-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-gen-ragel-read-from=<str> (--cache-gen-ragel-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-gen-ragel-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-gen-ragel-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-gen-ragel-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-gen-ragel-write-to=<str> (--cache-gen-ragel-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-gen-ragel-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-gen-ragel-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
      • gen.scrooge
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]gen-scrooge-strict (default: False)
            Enable strict compilation.
          • --[no-]gen-scrooge-use-nailgun (default: True)
            Use nailgun to make repeated invocations of this task quicker.
          • --[no-]gen-scrooge-verbose (default: False)
            Emit verbose output.
        • Advanced options
          • --[no-]gen-scrooge-allow-dups (default: False)
            Allow multiple targets specifying the same sources. If duplicates are allowed, the logic of find_sources will associate generated sources with the least-dependent targets that generate them.
          • --[no-]gen-scrooge-allow-empty (default: True)
            Skip targets with no sources defined.
          • --gen-scrooge-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --gen-scrooge-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--gen-scrooge-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --gen-scrooge-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --gen-scrooge-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]gen-scrooge-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --gen-scrooge-jvm-options=<str> (--gen-scrooge-jvm-options=<str>) ..., --gen-scrooge-jvm-options="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --gen-scrooge-jvm-options="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['-Xmx1g','-XX:MaxPermSize=256m'])
            Use these jvm options when running Scrooge.
          • --gen-scrooge-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --gen-scrooge-nailgun-connect-attempts=<int> (default: 5)
            Max attempts for nailgun connects.
          • --gen-scrooge-nailgun-server=<target_option> (default: //:nailgun-server)
            Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the nailgun-server jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'com.martiansoftware', base_name=u'nailgun-server', rev=u'0.9.1', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
          • --gen-scrooge-nailgun-timeout-seconds=<float> (default: 10.0)
            Timeout (secs) for nailgun startup.
          • --gen-scrooge-scrooge-gen=<target_option> (default: //:scrooge-gen)
            Target address spec for specifying the classpath of the scrooge-gen jvm tool.
          • --gen-scrooge-service-deps="{'key1':val1,'key2':val2,...}" (default: { 'java':'[u'3rdparty:slf4j-api', u'3rdparty:thrift-0.6.1', u'3rdparty/jvm/com/twitter:finagle-thrift', u'3rdparty/jvm/com/twitter:scrooge-core']','scala':'[u'3rdparty:thrift-0.6.1', u'3rdparty/jvm/com/twitter:finagle-thrift', u'3rdparty/jvm/com/twitter:scrooge-core']' })
            A map of language to targets to add as dependencies of synthetic thrift libraries that contain services.
          • --gen-scrooge-structs-deps="{'key1':val1,'key2':val2,...}" (default: { 'java':'[u'3rdparty:thrift-0.6.1', u'3rdparty/jvm/com/twitter:scrooge-core']','scala':'[u'3rdparty:thrift-0.6.1', u'3rdparty/jvm/com/twitter:scrooge-core']' })
            A map of language to targets to add as dependencies of synthetic thrift libraries that contain structs.
      • cache.gen.scrooge
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-gen-scrooge-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-scrooge-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-gen-scrooge-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-gen-scrooge-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-gen-scrooge-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-gen-scrooge-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-gen-scrooge-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-gen-scrooge-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-scrooge-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-gen-scrooge-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-gen-scrooge-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-scrooge-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-gen-scrooge-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-gen-scrooge-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-gen-scrooge-read-from=<str> (--cache-gen-scrooge-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-gen-scrooge-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-gen-scrooge-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-gen-scrooge-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-gen-scrooge-write-to=<str> (--cache-gen-scrooge-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-gen-scrooge-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-gen-scrooge-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
      • gen.spindle
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]gen-spindle-use-nailgun (default: True)
            Use nailgun to make repeated invocations of this task quicker.
        • Advanced options
          • --gen-spindle-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --gen-spindle-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--gen-spindle-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --gen-spindle-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --gen-spindle-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]gen-spindle-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --gen-spindle-jvm-options=<str> (--gen-spindle-jvm-options=<str>) ..., --gen-spindle-jvm-options="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --gen-spindle-jvm-options="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['-Xmx1g','-XX:MaxPermSize=256m'])
            Use these jvm options when running Spindle.
          • --gen-spindle-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --gen-spindle-nailgun-connect-attempts=<int> (default: 5)
            Max attempts for nailgun connects.
          • --gen-spindle-nailgun-server=<target_option> (default: //:nailgun-server)
            Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the nailgun-server jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'com.martiansoftware', base_name=u'nailgun-server', rev=u'0.9.1', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
          • --gen-spindle-nailgun-timeout-seconds=<float> (default: 10.0)
            Timeout (secs) for nailgun startup.
          • --gen-spindle-runtime-dependency=<str> (--gen-spindle-runtime-dependency=<str>) ..., --gen-spindle-runtime-dependency="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --gen-spindle-runtime-dependency="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['3rdparty:spindle-runtime'])
            A list of targets that all spindle codegen depends on at runtime.
          • --gen-spindle-spindle-codegen=<target_option> (default: //:spindle-codegen)
            Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the spindle-codegen jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'com.foursquare', base_name=u'spindle-codegen-binary_2.10', rev=u'3.0.0-M7', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
      • cache.gen.spindle
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-gen-spindle-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-spindle-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-gen-spindle-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-gen-spindle-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-gen-spindle-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-gen-spindle-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-gen-spindle-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-gen-spindle-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-spindle-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-gen-spindle-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-gen-spindle-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-spindle-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-gen-spindle-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-gen-spindle-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-gen-spindle-read-from=<str> (--cache-gen-spindle-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-gen-spindle-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-gen-spindle-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-gen-spindle-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-gen-spindle-write-to=<str> (--cache-gen-spindle-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-gen-spindle-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-gen-spindle-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
      • gen.thrift
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]gen-thrift-strict (default: True)
            Run thrift compiler with strict warnings.
        • Advanced options
          • --[no-]gen-thrift-allow-dups (default: False)
            Allow multiple targets specifying the same sources. If duplicates are allowed, the logic of find_sources will associate generated sources with the least-dependent targets that generate them.
          • --[no-]gen-thrift-allow-empty (default: True)
            Skip targets with no sources defined.
          • --gen-thrift-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --gen-thrift-deps=<str> (--gen-thrift-deps=<str>) ..., --gen-thrift-deps="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --gen-thrift-deps="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['3rdparty:thrift-0.9.2'])
            A list of specs pointing to dependencies of thrift generated java code.
          • --gen-thrift-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--gen-thrift-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --gen-thrift-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --gen-thrift-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]gen-thrift-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --gen-thrift-gen-options=<str> (default: 'hashcode')
            Use these apache thrift java gen options.
          • --gen-thrift-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --gen-thrift-service-deps=<str> (--gen-thrift-service-deps=<str>) ..., --gen-thrift-service-deps="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --gen-thrift-service-deps="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: [])
            A list of specs pointing to dependencies of thrift generated java service code. If not supplied, then --deps will be used for service deps.
      • thrift-binary.gen.thrift
        • Advanced options
          • --thrift-binary-gen-thrift-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --thrift-binary-gen-thrift-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--thrift-binary-gen-thrift-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --thrift-binary-gen-thrift-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --thrift-binary-gen-thrift-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]thrift-binary-gen-thrift-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --thrift-binary-gen-thrift-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --thrift-binary-gen-thrift-supportdir=<str> (default: 'bin/thrift')
            Find thrift binaries under this dir. Used as part of the path to lookup thetool with --binary-util-baseurls and --pants-bootstrapdir
          • --thrift-binary-gen-thrift-version=<str> (default: '0.9.2')
            Thrift compiler version. Used as part of the path to lookup thetool with --binary-util-baseurls and --pants-bootstrapdir
      • cache.gen.thrift
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-gen-thrift-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-thrift-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-gen-thrift-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-gen-thrift-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-gen-thrift-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-gen-thrift-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-gen-thrift-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-gen-thrift-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-thrift-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-gen-thrift-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-gen-thrift-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-thrift-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-gen-thrift-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-gen-thrift-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-gen-thrift-read-from=<str> (--cache-gen-thrift-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-gen-thrift-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-gen-thrift-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-gen-thrift-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-gen-thrift-write-to=<str> (--cache-gen-thrift-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-gen-thrift-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-gen-thrift-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
      • thrift-binary.gen.thrift
        • Advanced options
          • --thrift-binary-gen-thrift-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --thrift-binary-gen-thrift-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--thrift-binary-gen-thrift-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --thrift-binary-gen-thrift-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --thrift-binary-gen-thrift-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]thrift-binary-gen-thrift-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --thrift-binary-gen-thrift-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --thrift-binary-gen-thrift-supportdir=<str> (default: 'bin/thrift')
            Find thrift binaries under this dir. Used as part of the path to lookup thetool with --binary-util-baseurls and --pants-bootstrapdir
          • --thrift-binary-gen-thrift-version=<str> (default: '0.9.2')
            Thrift compiler version. Used as part of the path to lookup thetool with --binary-util-baseurls and --pants-bootstrapdir
      • gen.wire
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]gen-wire-use-nailgun (default: True)
            Use nailgun to make repeated invocations of this task quicker.
        • Advanced options
          • --[no-]gen-wire-allow-dups (default: False)
            Allow multiple targets specifying the same sources. If duplicates are allowed, the logic of find_sources will associate generated sources with the least-dependent targets that generate them.
          • --[no-]gen-wire-allow-empty (default: True)
            Skip targets with no sources defined.
          • --gen-wire-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --gen-wire-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--gen-wire-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --gen-wire-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --gen-wire-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]gen-wire-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --gen-wire-javadeps=<target_option> (default: //:wire-runtime)
            Runtime dependencies for wire-using Java code.
          • --gen-wire-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --gen-wire-nailgun-connect-attempts=<int> (default: 5)
            Max attempts for nailgun connects.
          • --gen-wire-nailgun-server=<target_option> (default: //:nailgun-server)
            Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the nailgun-server jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'com.martiansoftware', base_name=u'nailgun-server', rev=u'0.9.1', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
          • --gen-wire-nailgun-timeout-seconds=<float> (default: 10.0)
            Timeout (secs) for nailgun startup.
          • --gen-wire-wire-compiler=<target_option> (default: //:wire-compiler)
            Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the wire-compiler jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'com.squareup.wire', base_name=u'wire-compiler', rev=u'1.8.0', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
      • cache.gen.wire
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-gen-wire-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-wire-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-gen-wire-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-gen-wire-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-gen-wire-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-gen-wire-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-gen-wire-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-gen-wire-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-wire-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-gen-wire-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-gen-wire-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-gen-wire-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-gen-wire-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-gen-wire-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-gen-wire-read-from=<str> (--cache-gen-wire-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-gen-wire-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-gen-wire-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-gen-wire-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-gen-wire-write-to=<str> (--cache-gen-wire-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-gen-wire-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-gen-wire-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
    • go
      Runs an arbitrary go command against zero or more go targets.
      • cache.go
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-go-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-go-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-go-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-go-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-go-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-go-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-go-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-go-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-go-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-go-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-go-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-go-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-go-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-go-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-go-read-from=<str> (--cache-go-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-go-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-go-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-go-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-go-write-to=<str> (--cache-go-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-go-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-go-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
    • go-env
      Runs an arbitrary command in a go workspace defined by zero or more go targets.
      • cache.go-env
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-go-env-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-go-env-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-go-env-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-go-env-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-go-env-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-go-env-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-go-env-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-go-env-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-go-env-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-go-env-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-go-env-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-go-env-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-go-env-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-go-env-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-go-env-read-from=<str> (--cache-go-env-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-go-env-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-go-env-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-go-env-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-go-env-write-to=<str> (--cache-go-env-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-go-env-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-go-env-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.

          • --cache-goals-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-goals-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-goals-read-from=<str> (--cache-goals-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-goals-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-goals-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.

    • idea
      Create an IntelliJ IDEA project from the given targets.
      • cache.idea
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-idea-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-idea-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-idea-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-idea-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-idea-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-idea-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-idea-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-idea-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-idea-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-idea-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-idea-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-idea-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-idea-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-idea-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-idea-read-from=<str> (--cache-idea-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-idea-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-idea-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-idea-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-idea-write-to=<str> (--cache-idea-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-idea-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-idea-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])

    • imports
      Resolve external source dependencies.
      • imports.ivy-imports
        Resolves all jar files for the import_jar_libraries property on all `ImportJarsMixin` targets.
        • Basic options
          • --imports-ivy-imports-jvm-options=<option>... (--imports-ivy-imports-jvm-options=<option>...) ..., --imports-ivy-imports-jvm-options="[<option>..., <option>..., ...]", --imports-ivy-imports-jvm-options="+[<option>..., <option>..., ...]" (default: ['-Xmx1g','-XX:MaxPermSize=256m'])
            Run Ivy with these extra jvm options.
          • --[no-]imports-ivy-imports-use-nailgun (default: True)
            Use nailgun to make repeated invocations of this task quicker.
        • Advanced options
          • --imports-ivy-imports-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --imports-ivy-imports-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--imports-ivy-imports-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --imports-ivy-imports-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --imports-ivy-imports-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]imports-ivy-imports-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --imports-ivy-imports-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --imports-ivy-imports-nailgun-connect-attempts=<int> (default: 5)
            Max attempts for nailgun connects.
          • --imports-ivy-imports-nailgun-server=<target_option> (default: //:nailgun-server)
            Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the nailgun-server jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'com.martiansoftware', base_name=u'nailgun-server', rev=u'0.9.1', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
          • --imports-ivy-imports-nailgun-timeout-seconds=<float> (default: 10.0)
            Timeout (secs) for nailgun startup.
          • --[no-]imports-ivy-imports-soft-excludes (default: False)
            If a target depends on a jar that is excluded by another target resolve this jar anyway
      • cache.imports.ivy-imports
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-imports-ivy-imports-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-imports-ivy-imports-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-imports-ivy-imports-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-imports-ivy-imports-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-imports-ivy-imports-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-imports-ivy-imports-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-imports-ivy-imports-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-imports-ivy-imports-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-imports-ivy-imports-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-imports-ivy-imports-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-imports-ivy-imports-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-imports-ivy-imports-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-imports-ivy-imports-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-imports-ivy-imports-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-imports-ivy-imports-read-from=<str> (--cache-imports-ivy-imports-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-imports-ivy-imports-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-imports-ivy-imports-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-imports-ivy-imports-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-imports-ivy-imports-write-to=<str> (--cache-imports-ivy-imports-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-imports-ivy-imports-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-imports-ivy-imports-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
    • invalidate
      Invalidate the entire build.
      • cache.invalidate
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-invalidate-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-invalidate-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-invalidate-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-invalidate-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-invalidate-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-invalidate-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-invalidate-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-invalidate-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-invalidate-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-invalidate-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-invalidate-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-invalidate-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-invalidate-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-invalidate-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-invalidate-read-from=<str> (--cache-invalidate-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-invalidate-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-invalidate-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-invalidate-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-invalidate-write-to=<str> (--cache-invalidate-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-invalidate-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-invalidate-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
      • invalidate.ng-killall
        Kill running nailgun servers.
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]invalidate-ng-killall-everywhere (default: False)
            Kill all nailguns servers launched by pants for all workspaces on the system.
        • Advanced options
          • --invalidate-ng-killall-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --invalidate-ng-killall-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--invalidate-ng-killall-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --invalidate-ng-killall-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --invalidate-ng-killall-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]invalidate-ng-killall-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --invalidate-ng-killall-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
      • cache.invalidate.ng-killall
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-invalidate-ng-killall-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-invalidate-ng-killall-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-invalidate-ng-killall-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-invalidate-ng-killall-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-invalidate-ng-killall-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-invalidate-ng-killall-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-invalidate-ng-killall-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-invalidate-ng-killall-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-invalidate-ng-killall-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-invalidate-ng-killall-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-invalidate-ng-killall-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-invalidate-ng-killall-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-invalidate-ng-killall-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-invalidate-ng-killall-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-invalidate-ng-killall-read-from=<str> (--cache-invalidate-ng-killall-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-invalidate-ng-killall-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-invalidate-ng-killall-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-invalidate-ng-killall-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-invalidate-ng-killall-write-to=<str> (--cache-invalidate-ng-killall-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-invalidate-ng-killall-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-invalidate-ng-killall-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
    • jar
      Create a JAR file.
      • jar.create
        Jars jvm libraries and optionally their sources and their docs.
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]jar-create-compressed (default: True)
            Create compressed jars.
          • --[no-]jar-create-use-nailgun (default: True)
            Use nailgun to make repeated invocations of this task quicker.
        • Advanced options
          • --jar-create-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --jar-create-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--jar-create-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --jar-create-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --jar-create-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]jar-create-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --jar-create-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --jar-create-nailgun-connect-attempts=<int> (default: 5)
            Max attempts for nailgun connects.
          • --jar-create-nailgun-server=<target_option> (default: //:nailgun-server)
            Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the nailgun-server jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'com.martiansoftware', base_name=u'nailgun-server', rev=u'0.9.1', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
          • --jar-create-nailgun-timeout-seconds=<float> (default: 10.0)
            Timeout (secs) for nailgun startup.
      • cache.jar.create
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-jar-create-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-jar-create-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-jar-create-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-jar-create-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-jar-create-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-jar-create-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-jar-create-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-jar-create-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-jar-create-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-jar-create-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-jar-create-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-jar-create-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-jar-create-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-jar-create-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-jar-create-read-from=<str> (--cache-jar-create-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-jar-create-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-jar-create-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-jar-create-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-jar-create-write-to=<str> (--cache-jar-create-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-jar-create-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-jar-create-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
    • jvm-platform-explain
      Console task which provides helpful analysis about jvm platform dependencies.
      • cache.jvm-platform-explain
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-jvm-platform-explain-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-jvm-platform-explain-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-jvm-platform-explain-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-jvm-platform-explain-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-jvm-platform-explain-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-jvm-platform-explain-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-jvm-platform-explain-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-jvm-platform-explain-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-jvm-platform-explain-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-jvm-platform-explain-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-jvm-platform-explain-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-jvm-platform-explain-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-jvm-platform-explain-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-jvm-platform-explain-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-jvm-platform-explain-read-from=<str> (--cache-jvm-platform-explain-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-jvm-platform-explain-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-jvm-platform-explain-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-jvm-platform-explain-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-jvm-platform-explain-write-to=<str> (--cache-jvm-platform-explain-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-jvm-platform-explain-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-jvm-platform-explain-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
    • jvm-platform-validate
      Validation step that runs well in advance of jvm compile.
      • cache.jvm-platform-validate
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-jvm-platform-validate-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-jvm-platform-validate-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.

          • --cache-jvm-platform-validate-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')

          • --cache-jvm-platform-validate-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-jvm-platform-validate-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-jvm-platform-validate-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-jvm-platform-validate-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-jvm-platform-validate-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-jvm-platform-validate-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.

            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair

            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.

            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.

            number of seconds before pinger times out

            number of times pinger tries a cache

          • --cache-kill-pantsd-write-to=<str> (--cache-kill-pantsd-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-kill-pantsd-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-kill-pantsd-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
