          • --cache-test-test-prep-command-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-test-test-prep-command-write-to=<str> (--cache-test-test-prep-command-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-test-test-prep-command-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-test-test-prep-command-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
    • test-changed
      Find and test changed targets.
      • cache.test-changed
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-test-changed-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-test-changed-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-test-changed-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-test-changed-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-test-changed-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-test-changed-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-test-changed-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-test-changed-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-test-changed-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-test-changed-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-test-changed-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-test-changed-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-test-changed-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-test-changed-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-test-changed-read-from=<str> (--cache-test-changed-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-test-changed-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-test-changed-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-test-changed-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-test-changed-write-to=<str> (--cache-test-changed-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-test-changed-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-test-changed-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
    • thrift-linter
      Print linter warnings for thrift files.
      • cache.thrift-linter
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-thrift-linter-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-thrift-linter-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-thrift-linter-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-thrift-linter-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-thrift-linter-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-thrift-linter-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-thrift-linter-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-thrift-linter-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-thrift-linter-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-thrift-linter-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-thrift-linter-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-thrift-linter-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-thrift-linter-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-thrift-linter-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-thrift-linter-read-from=<str> (--cache-thrift-linter-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-thrift-linter-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-thrift-linter-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-thrift-linter-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-thrift-linter-write-to=<str> (--cache-thrift-linter-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-thrift-linter-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-thrift-linter-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
    • unpack-jars
      Unpack artifacts specified by unpacked_jars() targets.
      • cache.unpack-jars
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-unpack-jars-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-unpack-jars-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-unpack-jars-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-unpack-jars-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-unpack-jars-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-unpack-jars-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-unpack-jars-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-unpack-jars-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-unpack-jars-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-unpack-jars-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-unpack-jars-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-unpack-jars-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-unpack-jars-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-unpack-jars-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-unpack-jars-read-from=<str> (--cache-unpack-jars-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-unpack-jars-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-unpack-jars-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-unpack-jars-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-unpack-jars-write-to=<str> (--cache-unpack-jars-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-unpack-jars-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-unpack-jars-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
      • unpack-jars.unpack-libs
        Unpack AndroidDependency artifacts, including .jar and .aar libraries.
        • Advanced options
          • --unpack-jars-unpack-libs-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --unpack-jars-unpack-libs-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--unpack-jars-unpack-libs-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --unpack-jars-unpack-libs-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --unpack-jars-unpack-libs-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]unpack-jars-unpack-libs-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --unpack-jars-unpack-libs-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
      • cache.unpack-jars.unpack-libs
        • Basic options
          • --[no-]cache-unpack-jars-unpack-libs-read (default: True)
            Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
          • --[no-]cache-unpack-jars-unpack-libs-write (default: True)
            Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
        • Advanced options
          • --cache-unpack-jars-unpack-libs-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
            The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
          • --cache-unpack-jars-unpack-libs-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
            The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
          • --cache-unpack-jars-unpack-libs-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-unpack-jars-unpack-libs-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-unpack-jars-unpack-libs-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-unpack-jars-unpack-libs-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
            Exclude targets that match these regexes.
          • --[no-]cache-unpack-jars-unpack-libs-fail-fast (default: False)
            Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
          • --cache-unpack-jars-unpack-libs-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
            Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
          • --cache-unpack-jars-unpack-libs-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
            Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
          • --[no-]cache-unpack-jars-unpack-libs-overwrite (default: False)
            If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
          • --cache-unpack-jars-unpack-libs-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
            number of seconds before pinger times out
          • --cache-unpack-jars-unpack-libs-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
            number of times pinger tries a cache
          • --cache-unpack-jars-unpack-libs-read-from=<str> (--cache-unpack-jars-unpack-libs-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-unpack-jars-unpack-libs-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-unpack-jars-unpack-libs-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
          • --cache-unpack-jars-unpack-libs-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
            Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
          • --cache-unpack-jars-unpack-libs-write-to=<str> (--cache-unpack-jars-unpack-libs-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-unpack-jars-unpack-libs-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-unpack-jars-unpack-libs-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.cache'])
            The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
  • Subsystem Options
    • fetchers
      A registry of installed remote code fetchers.
      • Advanced options
        • --fetchers-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --fetchers-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--fetchers-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --fetchers-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --fetchers-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]fetchers-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --fetchers-mapping=<mapping> (default: { 'bitbucket\.org/.*':'ArchiveFetcher','golang\.org/x/.*':'ArchiveFetcher','github\.com/.*':'ArchiveFetcher','google\.golang\.org/.*':'ArchiveFetcher','gopkg\.in/.*':'GopkgInFetcher' })
          A mapping from a remote import path matching regex to a fetcher type to use to fetch the remote sources. The regex must match the beginning of the remote import path; no '^' anchor is needed, it is assumed. The Fetcher types are fully qualified class names or else an installed alias for a fetcher type; I.e., the built-in 'contrib.go.subsystems.fetchers.ArchiveFetcher' is aliased as 'ArchiveFetcher'.
        • --fetchers-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
    • jvm
      A JVM invocation.
      • Basic options
        • --[no-]jvm-debug (default: False)
          Run the JVM with remote debugging.
        • --jvm-options=<option>... (--jvm-options=<option>...) ..., --jvm-options="[<option>..., <option>..., ...]", --jvm-options="+[<option>..., <option>..., ...]" (default: ['-Xmx1g','-XX:MaxPermSize=256m'])
          Run with these extra JVM options.
        • --jvm-program-args=<arg>... (--jvm-program-args=<arg>...) ..., --jvm-program-args="[<arg>..., <arg>..., ...]", --jvm-program-args="+[<arg>..., <arg>..., ...]" (default: [])
          Run with these extra program args.
      • Advanced options
        • --jvm-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --jvm-debug-args=<str> (--jvm-debug-args=<str>) ..., --jvm-debug-args="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --jvm-debug-args="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['-Xdebug','-Xrunjdwp:transport=dt_socket,server=y,suspend=y,address={debug_port}'])
          The JVM remote-debugging arguments. {debug_port} will be replaced with the value of the --debug-port option.
        • --jvm-debug-port=<int> (default: 5005)
          The JVM will listen for a debugger on this port.
        • --jvm-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--jvm-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --jvm-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --jvm-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]jvm-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --jvm-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
        • --[no-]jvm-synthetic-classpath (default: True)
          Use synthetic jar to work around classpath length restrictions.
    • archive-fetcher
      A fetcher that knows how find archives for remote import paths and unpack them.
      • Advanced options
        • --archive-fetcher-buffer-size=<bytes> (default: 10240)
          The number of bytes of archive content to buffer in memory before flushing to disk when downloading an archive.
        • --archive-fetcher-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --archive-fetcher-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--archive-fetcher-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --archive-fetcher-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --archive-fetcher-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]archive-fetcher-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --archive-fetcher-matchers=<mapping> (default: { 'google\.golang\.org/.*':'UrlInfo(url_format=u'{meta_repo_url}/+archive/{rev}.tar.gz', default_rev=u'master', strip_level=0)','github\.com/(?P<user>[^/]+)/(?P<repo>[^/]+)':'UrlInfo(url_format=u'https://github.com/\\g<user>/\\g<repo>/archive/{rev}.tar.gz', default_rev=u'master', strip_level=1)','bitbucket\.org/(?P<user>[^/]+)/(?P<repo>[^/]+)':'UrlInfo(url_format=u'https://bitbucket.org/\\g<user>/\\g<repo>/get/{rev}.tar.gz', default_rev=u'tip', strip_level=1)','golang\.org/x/(?P<repo>[^/]+)':'UrlInfo(url_format=u'https://github.com/golang/\\g<repo>/archive/{rev}.tar.gz', default_rev=u'master', strip_level=1)' })
          A mapping from a remote import path matching regex to an UrlInfo struct describing how to fetch and unpack a remote import path. The regex must match the beginning of the remote import path (no '^' anchor is needed, it is assumed) until the first path element that is contained in the archive. (e.g. for 'bazil.org/fuse/fs', which lives in the archive of 'bazil.org/fuse', it must match 'bazil.org/fuse'.) The UrlInfo struct is a 3-tuple with the following slots: 0. An url format string that is supplied to the regex match's `.template` method and then formatted with the remote import path's `rev`, `import_prefix`, and `pkg`. 1. The default revision string to use when no `rev` is supplied; ie 'HEAD' or 'master' for git. 2. An integer indicating the number of leading path components to strip from files upacked from the archive. An example configuration that works against github.com is: {r'github.com/(?P<user>[^/]+)/(?P<repo>[^/]+)': ('https://github.com/\g<user>/\g<repo>/archive/{rev}.zip', 'master', 1)}
        • --archive-fetcher-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
        • --archive-fetcher-prefixes=<paths> (--archive-fetcher-prefixes=<paths>) ..., --archive-fetcher-prefixes="[<paths>, <paths>, ...]", --archive-fetcher-prefixes="+[<paths>, <paths>, ...]" (default: [])
          Known import-prefixes for go packages
        • --archive-fetcher-retries=<str> (default: '1')
          How many times to retry to fetch a remote library.
    • npm-resolver
      • Advanced options
        • --npm-resolver-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --npm-resolver-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--npm-resolver-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --npm-resolver-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --npm-resolver-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]npm-resolver-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --npm-resolver-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
    • pantsd
      A subsystem that manages the configuration and launching of pantsd.
      • Advanced options
        • --pantsd-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --pantsd-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--pantsd-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --pantsd-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --pantsd-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]pantsd-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --[no-]pantsd-fs-event-detection (default: False)
          Whether or not to use filesystem event detection. Experimental.
        • --pantsd-fs-event-workers=<int> (default: 4)
          The number of workers to use for the filesystem event service executor pool. Experimental.
        • --pantsd-log-dir=<str> (default: None)
          The directory to log pantsd output to.
        • --pantsd-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
        • --pantsd-pailgun-host=<str> (default: '127.0.0.1')
          The host to bind the pants nailgun server to.
        • --pantsd-pailgun-port=<int> (default: 0)
          The port to bind the pants nailgun server to. Defaults to a random port.
    • pycheck-pep8
      • Basic options
        • --pycheck-pep8-ignore=<str> (--pycheck-pep8-ignore=<str>) ..., --pycheck-pep8-ignore="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --pycheck-pep8-ignore="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['E121','E124','E125','E127','E128','E401','E111','W291','W293','E701','E301','E302','W292'])
          Prevent test failure but still produce output for problems.
        • --pycheck-pep8-max-length=<int> (default: 100)
          Max line length to use for PEP8 checks.
        • --[no-]pycheck-pep8-skip (default: True)
          If enabled, skip this style checker.
      • Advanced options
        • --pycheck-pep8-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --pycheck-pep8-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--pycheck-pep8-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --pycheck-pep8-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --pycheck-pep8-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]pycheck-pep8-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --pycheck-pep8-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
    • pycheck-print-statements
      • Basic options
        • --[no-]pycheck-print-statements-skip (default: False)
          If enabled, skip this style checker.
      • Advanced options
        • --pycheck-print-statements-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --pycheck-print-statements-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--pycheck-print-statements-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --pycheck-print-statements-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --pycheck-print-statements-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]pycheck-print-statements-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --pycheck-print-statements-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
    • shader
      • Advanced options
        • --shader-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --shader-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--shader-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --shader-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --shader-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]shader-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --shader-jarjar=<target_option> (default: //:jarjar)
          Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the jarjar jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'org.pantsbuild', base_name=u'jarjar', rev=u'1.6.2', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
        • --shader-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
    • statsdb
      • Basic options
        • --statsdb-path=<str> (default: '/Users/stuhood/.cache/pants/stats/statsdb.sqlite')
          Location of statsdb file.
      • Advanced options
        • --statsdb-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --statsdb-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--statsdb-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --statsdb-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --statsdb-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]statsdb-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --statsdb-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
    • cache
      • Basic options
        • --[no-]cache-read (default: True)
          Read build artifacts from cache, if available.
        • --[no-]cache-write (default: True)
          Write build artifacts to cache, if available.
      • Advanced options
        • --cache-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --cache-compression-level=<int> (default: 5)
          The gzip compression level (0-9) for created artifacts.
        • --cache-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--cache-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --cache-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --cache-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]cache-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --cache-max-entries-per-target=<int> (default: 8)
          Maximum number of old cache files to keep per task target pair
        • --cache-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
        • --[no-]cache-overwrite (default: False)
          If writing build artifacts to cache, overwrite existing artifacts instead of skipping them.
        • --cache-pinger-timeout=<float> (default: 0.5)
          number of seconds before pinger times out
        • --cache-pinger-tries=<int> (default: 2)
          number of times pinger tries a cache
        • --cache-read-from=<str> (--cache-read-from=<str>) ..., --cache-read-from="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-read-from="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: [])
          The URIs of artifact caches to read directly from. Each entry is a URL of a RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
        • --cache-resolver=<str> (default: 'none')
          Select which resolver strategy to use for discovering URIs that access artifact caches. none: use URIs from static config options, i.e. --read-from, --write-to. rest: look up URIs by querying a RESTful URL, which is a remote address from --read-from, --write-to.
        • --cache-write-to=<str> (--cache-write-to=<str>) ..., --cache-write-to="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --cache-write-to="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: [])
          The URIs of artifact caches to write directly to. Each entry is a URL ofa RESTful cache, a path of a filesystem cache, or a pipe-separated list of alternate caches to choose from. This list is also used as input to the resolver. When resolver is 'none' list is used as is.
    • repro
      • Basic options
        • --repro-capture=<repro_path> (default: None)
          Capture information about this pants run (including the entire workspace) into a tar.gz file that can be used to help debug build problems.
        • --repro-ignore=<str> (--repro-ignore=<str>) ..., --repro-ignore="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --repro-ignore="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: [])
          Any paths specified here will not be included in repro tarballs.
      • Advanced options
        • --repro-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --repro-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--repro-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --repro-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --repro-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]repro-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --repro-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.

    • scala-platform
      A scala platform.
      • Advanced options
        • --scala-platform-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --scala-platform-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--scala-platform-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --scala-platform-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --scala-platform-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]scala-platform-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --[no-]scala-platform-fatal-warnings (default: False)
          The default for the "fatal_warnings" argument for targets of this language.
        • --scala-platform-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
        • --scala-platform-repl-spec=<str> (default: '//:scala-repl')
          Address to be used for custom scala runtime.
        • --scala-platform-runtime-spec=<str> (default: '//:scala-library')
          Address to be used for custom scala runtime.
        • --scala-platform-scala_2_10_repl=<target_option> (default: //:scala_2_10_repl)
          Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the scala_2_10_repl jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'org.scala-lang', base_name=u'scala-compiler', rev=u'2.10.4', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=()), JarDependency(org=u'org.scala-lang', base_name=u'jline', rev=u'2.10.4', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
        • --scala-platform-scala_2_11_repl=<target_option> (default: //:scala_2_11_repl)
          Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the scala_2_11_repl jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'org.scala-lang', base_name=u'scala-compiler', rev=u'2.11.7', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
        • --scala-platform-scala_repl=<target_option> (default: //:scala_repl)
          Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the scala_repl jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'org.scala-lang', base_name=u'scala-compiler', rev=None, force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=()), JarDependency(org=u'org.scala-lang', base_name=u'jline', rev=u'2.10.4', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
        • --scala-platform-scalac=<target_option> (default: //:scalac)
          Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the scalac jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'org.scala-lang', base_name=u'scala-compiler', rev=None, force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
        • --scala-platform-scalac_2_10=<target_option> (default: //:scalac_2_10)
          Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the scalac_2_10 jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'org.scala-lang', base_name=u'scala-compiler', rev=u'2.10.4', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
        • --scala-platform-scalac_2_11=<target_option> (default: //:scalac_2_11)
          Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the scalac_2_11 jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'org.scala-lang', base_name=u'scala-compiler', rev=u'2.11.7', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
        • --scala-platform-scalastyle=<target_option> (default: //:scalastyle)
          Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the scalastyle jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'org.scalastyle', base_name=u'scalastyle_custom', rev=None, force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
        • --scala-platform-scalastyle_2_10=<target_option> (default: //:scalastyle_2_10)
          Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the scalastyle_2_10 jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'org.scalastyle', base_name=u'scalastyle_2.10', rev=u'0.3.2', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
        • --scala-platform-scalastyle_2_11=<target_option> (default: //:scalastyle_2_11)
          Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the scalastyle_2_11 jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'org.scalastyle', base_name=u'scalastyle_2.11', rev=u'0.8.0', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
        • --[no-]scala-platform-strict-deps (default: False)
          The default for the "strict_deps" argument for targets of this language.
        • --scala-platform-suffix-version=<str> (default: None)
          Scala suffix to be used when a custom version is specified. For example 2.10
        • --scala-platform-version=<str> (default: '2.10')
          The scala "platform version", which is suffixed onto all published libraries. This should match the declared compiler/library versions. Version specified will allow the user provide some sane defaults for common versions of scala. If version is something other than one of the common versions the user will be able to override the defaults by specifying "custom" as the --version, custom build targets can be specified in the targets for //:scalac and //:scala-library
    • jvm-platform
      Used to keep track of repo compile settings.
      • Advanced options
        • --jvm-platform-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --jvm-platform-default-platform=<str> (default: 'java6')
          Name of the default platform to use if none are specified.
        • --jvm-platform-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--jvm-platform-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --jvm-platform-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --jvm-platform-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]jvm-platform-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --jvm-platform-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
        • --jvm-platform-platforms="{'key1':val1,'key2':val2,...}" (default: { 'java7':'{u'source': u'7', u'args': [], u'target': u'7'}','java6':'{u'source': u'6', u'args': [], u'target': u'6'}','java8':'{u'source': u'8', u'args': [], u'target': u'8'}' })
          Compile settings that can be referred to by name in jvm_targets.

    • python-setup
      A python environment.
      • Advanced options
        • --python-setup-artifact-cache-dir=<dir> (default: None)
          The parent directory for the python artifact cache. If unspecified, a standard path under the workdir is used.
        • --python-setup-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --python-setup-chroot-cache-dir=<dir> (default: None)
          The parent directory for the chroot cache. If unspecified, a standard path under the workdir is used.
        • --python-setup-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--python-setup-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --python-setup-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --python-setup-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]python-setup-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --python-setup-interpreter-cache-dir=<dir> (default: '/Users/stuhood/.cache/pants/python_cache/interpreters')
          The parent directory for the interpreter cache. If unspecified, a standard path under the workdir is used.
        • --python-setup-interpreter-requirement=<str> (default: 'CPython>=2.7,<3')
          The interpreter requirement string for this python environment.
        • --python-setup-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
        • --python-setup-platforms=<str> (--python-setup-platforms=<str>) ..., --python-setup-platforms="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --python-setup-platforms="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['current'])
          The wheel version for this python environment.
        • --python-setup-resolver-cache-dir=<dir> (default: '/Users/stuhood/.cache/pants/python_cache/requirements')
          The parent directory for the requirement resolver cache. If unspecified, a standard path under the workdir is used.
        • --python-setup-resolver-cache-ttl=<seconds> (default: 315360000)
          The time in seconds before we consider re-resolving an open-ended requirement, e.g. "flask>=0.2" if a matching distribution is available on disk.
        • --python-setup-setuptools-version=<str> (default: '5.4.1')
          The setuptools version for this python environment.
        • --python-setup-wheel-version=<str> (default: '0.24.0')
          The wheel version for this python environment.

        • --[no-]pycheck-import-order-fail-fast (default: False)

        • --pycheck-import-order-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
    • jvm-distributions
      Subsystem that knows how to look up a java Distribution.
      • Advanced options
        • --jvm-distributions-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --jvm-distributions-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--jvm-distributions-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --jvm-distributions-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --jvm-distributions-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]jvm-distributions-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --jvm-distributions-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
        • --jvm-distributions-maximum-version=<str> (default: None)
          Maximum version of the JVM pants will use
        • --jvm-distributions-minimum-version=<str> (default: None)
          Minimum version of the JVM pants will use
        • --jvm-distributions-paths="{'key1':val1,'key2':val2,...}" (default: None)
          Map of os names to lists of paths to jdks. These paths will be searched before everything else (before the JDK_HOME, JAVA_HOME, PATH environment variables) when locating a jvm to use. The same OS can be specified via several different aliases, according to this map: darwin: [darwin, mac, mac os x, macos, macosx], linux: [linux, linux2]
    • jar-tool
      • Advanced options
        • --jar-tool-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --jar-tool-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--jar-tool-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --jar-tool-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --jar-tool-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]jar-tool-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --jar-tool-jar-tool=<target_option> (default: //:jar-tool)
          Target address spec for overriding the classpath of the jar-tool jvm tool which is, by default: [JarDependency(org=u'org.pantsbuild', base_name=u'jar-tool', rev=u'0.0.10', force=False, ext=None, url=None, apidocs=None, classifier=None, mutable=None, intransitive=False, excludes=())]
        • --jar-tool-jvm-options=<str> (--jar-tool-jvm-options=<str>) ..., --jar-tool-jvm-options="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --jar-tool-jvm-options="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['-Xmx1g','-XX:MaxPermSize=256m'])
          Run the jar tool with these JVM options.
        • --jar-tool-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
    • unknown-arguments
      Subsystem for validating unknown keyword arguments.
      • Advanced options
        • --unknown-arguments-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --unknown-arguments-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--unknown-arguments-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --unknown-arguments-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --unknown-arguments-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]unknown-arguments-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --unknown-arguments-ignored="{'key1':val1,'key2':val2,...}" (default: None)
          Map of target name to a list of keyword arguments that should be ignored if a target receives them unexpectedly. Typically used to allow usage of arguments in BUILD files that are not yet available in the current version of pants.
        • --unknown-arguments-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
    • pycheck-class-factoring
      • Basic options
        • --[no-]pycheck-class-factoring-skip (default: True)
          If enabled, skip this style checker.
      • Advanced options
        • --pycheck-class-factoring-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --pycheck-class-factoring-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--pycheck-class-factoring-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --pycheck-class-factoring-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --pycheck-class-factoring-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]pycheck-class-factoring-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --pycheck-class-factoring-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
    • pycheck-variable-names
      • Basic options
        • --[no-]pycheck-variable-names-skip (default: True)
          If enabled, skip this style checker.
      • Advanced options
        • --pycheck-variable-names-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --pycheck-variable-names-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--pycheck-variable-names-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --pycheck-variable-names-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --pycheck-variable-names-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]pycheck-variable-names-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --pycheck-variable-names-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.

          The default for the "strict_deps" argument for targets of this language.

    • ivy
      Common configuration items for ivy tasks.
      • Advanced options
        • --ivy-bootstrap-fetch-timeout-secs=<int> (default: 10)
          Timeout the fetch if the connection is idle for longer than this value.
        • --ivy-bootstrap-jar-url=<str> (default: 'https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/apache/ivy/ivy/2.4.0/ivy-2.4.0.jar')
          Location to download a bootstrap version of Ivy.
        • --ivy-cache-dir=<str> (default: '/Users/stuhood/.ivy2/pants')
          Directory to store artifacts retrieved by Ivy.
        • --ivy-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --ivy-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--ivy-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --ivy-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --ivy-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]ivy-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --ivy-http-proxy=<str> (default: None)
          Specify a proxy URL for http requests.
        • --ivy-https-proxy=<str> (default: None)
          Specify a proxy URL for https requests.
        • --ivy-ivy-profile=<str> (default: '/Users/stuhood/src/pants/build-support/ivy/ivy.xml')
          The version of ivy to fetch.
        • --ivy-ivy-settings=<str> (default: '/Users/stuhood/src/pants/build-support/ivy/ivysettings.xml')
          Location of XML configuration file for Ivy settings.
        • --ivy-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
    • reporting
      • Basic options
        • --[no-]reporting-invalidation-report (default: False)
          Write a formatted report on the invalid objects to the specified path.
      • Advanced options
        • --reporting-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --reporting-console-label-format="{'key1':val1,'key2':val2,...}" (default: { 'BOOTSTRAP':'CHILD_SUPPRESS','MULTITOOL':'CHILD_DOT' })
          Controls the printing of workunit labels to the console. Workunit types are ['BOOTSTRAP', 'COMPILER', 'GOAL', 'GROUP', 'JVM', 'MULTITOOL', 'NAILGUN', 'PREP', 'REPL', 'RUN', 'SETUP', 'TASK', 'TEST', 'TOOL']. Possible formatting values are ['CHILD_DOT', 'CHILD_SUPPRESS', 'DOT', 'FULL', 'SUPPRESS']
        • --reporting-console-tool-output-format="{'key1':val1,'key2':val2,...}" (default: { 'RUN':'UNINDENTED','BOOTSTRAP':'SUPPRESS','REPL':'UNINDENTED','TEST':'INDENT','MULTITOOL':'SUPPRESS','COMPILER':'INDENT' })
          Controls the printing of workunit tool output to the console. Workunit types are ['BOOTSTRAP', 'COMPILER', 'GOAL', 'GROUP', 'JVM', 'MULTITOOL', 'NAILGUN', 'PREP', 'REPL', 'RUN', 'SETUP', 'TASK', 'TEST', 'TOOL']. Possible formatting values are ['INDENT', 'SUPPRESS', 'UNINDENTED']
        • --reporting-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--reporting-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --reporting-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --reporting-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]reporting-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --reporting-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
        • --reporting-reports-dir=<dir> (default: '/Users/stuhood/src/pants/.pants.d/reports')
          Write reports to this dir.
        • --reporting-template-dir=<dir> (default: None)
          Find templates for rendering in this dir.
    • run-tracker
      Tracks and times the execution of a pants run.
      • Advanced options
        • --run-tracker-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --run-tracker-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--run-tracker-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --run-tracker-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --run-tracker-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]run-tracker-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --run-tracker-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
        • --run-tracker-num-background-workers=<int> (default: 4)
          Number of threads for background work.
        • --run-tracker-num-foreground-workers=<int> (default: 4)
          Number of threads for foreground work.
        • --run-tracker-stats-local-json-file=<str> (default: None)
          Write stats to this local json file on run completion.
        • --run-tracker-stats-upload-timeout=<int> (default: 2)
          Wait at most this many seconds for the stats upload to complete.
        • --run-tracker-stats-upload-url=<str> (default: None)
          Upload stats to this URL on run completion.
    • binaries
      • Advanced options
        • --binaries-baseurls=<str> (--binaries-baseurls=<str>) ..., --binaries-baseurls="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --binaries-baseurls="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['https://dl.bintray.com/pantsbuild/bin/build-support'])
          List of urls from which binary tools are downloaded. Urls are searched in order until the requested path is found.
        • --binaries-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --binaries-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--binaries-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --binaries-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --binaries-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]binaries-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --binaries-fetch-timeout-secs=<int> (default: 30)
          Timeout in seconds for url reads when fetching binary tools from the repos specified by --baseurls
        • --binaries-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
        • --binaries-path-by-id="{'key1':val1,'key2':val2,...}" (default: None)
          Maps output of uname for a machine to a binary search path. e.g. { ("darwin", "15"): ["mac", "10.11"]), ("linux", "arm32"): ["linux", "arm32"] }
    • thrift-binary
      • Advanced options
        • --thrift-binary-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --thrift-binary-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--thrift-binary-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --thrift-binary-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --thrift-binary-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]thrift-binary-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --thrift-binary-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
        • --thrift-binary-supportdir=<str> (default: 'bin/thrift')
          Find thrift binaries under this dir. Used as part of the path to lookup thetool with --binary-util-baseurls and --pants-bootstrapdir
        • --thrift-binary-version=<str> (default: '0.9.2')
          Thrift compiler version. Used as part of the path to lookup thetool with --binary-util-baseurls and --pants-bootstrapdir
    • source
      Configuration for roots of source trees.
      • Advanced options
        • --source-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --source-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--source-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --source-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --source-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]source-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --source-lang-canonicalizations=<map> (default: { 'py':'(u'python',)','protobuf':'(u'proto',)','jvm':'(u'java', u'scala')' })
          Map of language aliases to their canonical names.
        • --source-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
        • --source-source-root-patterns=<list> (--source-source-root-patterns=<list>) ..., --source-source-root-patterns="[<list>, <list>, ...]", --source-source-root-patterns="+[<list>, <list>, ...]" (default: ['3rdparty/*','src/*','src/main/*'])
          A list of source root patterns. Use a "*" wildcard path segment to match the language name, which will be canonicalized.
        • --source-source-roots=<map> (default: { '3rdparty/go':'(u'go_remote',)','contrib/go/examples/3rdparty/go':'(u'go_remote',)' })
          A map of source roots to list of languages. Useful when you want to enumerate fixed source roots explicitly, instead of relying on patterns.
        • --source-test-root-patterns=<list> (--source-test-root-patterns=<list>) ..., --source-test-root-patterns="[<list>, <list>, ...]", --source-test-root-patterns="+[<list>, <list>, ...]" (default: ['test/*','tests/*','src/test/*'])
          A list of source root patterns. Use a "*" wildcard path segment to match the language name, which will be canonicalized.
        • --source-test-roots=<map> (default: { })
          A map of test roots to list of languages. Useful when you want to enumerate fixed test roots explicitly, instead of relying on patterns.
        • --source-unmatched=<str> (default: 'create')
          Configures the behaviour when sources are defined outside of any configured source root. `create` will cause a source root to be implicitly created at the definition location of the sources; `fail` will trigger an error.

    • jar-dependency-management
      Used to keep track of pinning of external artifact versions.
      • Basic options
        • --jar-dependency-management-conflict-strategy=<str> (default: 'FAIL')
          Specifies how to behave when a jar_library has a jar with an explicit version that differs from one in the managed_jar_dependencies target it depends on.
        • --[no-]jar-dependency-management-suppress-conflict-warnings (default: False)
          Turns warning messages into debug messages when resolving jar conflicts.
      • Advanced options
        • --jar-dependency-management-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --jar-dependency-management-default-target=<str> (default: None)
          Address of the default managed_jar_dependencies target to use for the whole repo.
        • --jar-dependency-management-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--jar-dependency-management-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --jar-dependency-management-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --jar-dependency-management-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.

        • --python-repos-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --python-repos-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--python-repos-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --python-repos-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --python-repos-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]python-repos-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --python-repos-indexes=<str> (--python-repos-indexes=<str>) ..., --python-repos-indexes="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --python-repos-indexes="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: ['https://pypi.python.org/simple/'])
          URLs of code repository indexes.
        • --python-repos-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
        • --python-repos-repos=<str> (--python-repos-repos=<str>) ..., --python-repos-repos="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --python-repos-repos="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: [])
          URLs of code repositories.
    • pycheck-except-statement
      • Basic options
        • --[no-]pycheck-except-statement-skip (default: False)
          If enabled, skip this style checker.
      • Advanced options
        • --pycheck-except-statement-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --pycheck-except-statement-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--pycheck-except-statement-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --pycheck-except-statement-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --pycheck-except-statement-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]pycheck-except-statement-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --pycheck-except-statement-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
    • pycheck-pyflakes
      • Basic options
        • --pycheck-pyflakes-ignore=<str> (--pycheck-pyflakes-ignore=<str>) ..., --pycheck-pyflakes-ignore="[<str>, <str>, ...]", --pycheck-pyflakes-ignore="+[<str>, <str>, ...]" (default: [])
          List of warning codes to ignore.
        • --[no-]pycheck-pyflakes-skip (default: False)
          If enabled, skip this style checker.
      • Advanced options
        • --pycheck-pyflakes-cache-key-gen-version=<str> (default: '200')
          The cache key generation. Bump this to invalidate every artifact for a scope.
        • --pycheck-pyflakes-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp> (--pycheck-pyflakes-exclude-target-regexp=<regexp>) ..., --pycheck-pyflakes-exclude-target-regexp="[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]", --pycheck-pyflakes-exclude-target-regexp="+[<regexp>, <regexp>, ...]" (default: [])
          Exclude targets that match these regexes.
        • --[no-]pycheck-pyflakes-fail-fast (default: False)
          Exit as quickly as possible on error, rather than attempting to continue to process the non-erroneous subset of the input.
        • --pycheck-pyflakes-max-subprocess-args=<int> (default: 100)
          Used to limit the number of arguments passed to some subprocesses by breaking the command up into multiple invocations.
